title: How to Make a Duct Tape Bowl

steps.headline: Cut eight (8) strips of duct tape each 12 inches (30.5 cm) long.
Set six (6) of the strips that you cut in the previous step aside.
Make a cross from the remaining two (2) strips with the sticky side up on both pieces.
Repeat Step 3 three (3) more times with the remaining six (6) strips, making three more crosses.
Use two (2) of the crosses to make an asterisk sticky side up, and repeat with the other two.
You should now have two asterisks.
steps.description: With sticky sides facing each other, lay one of asterisk on top of the other slightly off center, so you have exposed sticky edges.

steps.headline: Assume that the asterisk is a compass, and that the top point is north.
Connect the north point with the northeast point, bringing the adjacent (two sides next to each other) sides together, and taping them.
steps.description: Go clockwise around the entire asterisk.

steps.headline: Tape as necessary to cover up holes and trim the edges.
Finished.
steps.description: Your bowl is now ready for use!

text: Cut eight (8) strips of duct tape each 12 inches (30.5 cm) long.  Set six (6) of the strips that you cut in the previous step aside.  Make a cross from the remaining two (2) strips with the sticky side up on both pieces.  Repeat Step 3 three (3) more times with the remaining six (6) strips, making three more crosses.  Use two (2) of the crosses to make an asterisk sticky side up, and repeat with the other two.  You should now have two asterisks. With sticky sides facing each other, lay one of asterisk on top of the other slightly off center, so you have exposed sticky edges. Assume that the asterisk is a compass, and that the top point is north.  Connect the north point with the northeast point, bringing the adjacent (two sides next to each other) sides together, and taping them. Go clockwise around the entire asterisk. Tape as necessary to cover up holes and trim the edges.  Finished. Your bowl is now ready for use!
